div.p: La Trobe Australian Manuscripts Collection, State Library of Victoria, Melbourne.

To proof. Trans. 22.7.92. To proof. (Sara, you had it as 59.12.00b)
i.e. his brother. Port Macquarie, 1 January 1860.

[Vor einigen Tagen kam ich vom Gebirge und hoffte einen Brief von Dr. Mueller und meine Zurückberufung nach Melbourne zu finden, indem mir der geringe Erfolg, den ich hatte, alles entleidet. Ich soll nun aber nach dem Mc[...] gehen und hoffe, hier besser zu machen. Von der Expedition höre ich noch gar nichts. Dr. Müller hat mir das 8. Fasci[kel] der Fragmente geschickt, in welchem er einen Ozothamnus, den ich hier gefunden, nach mir benannt hat "Ozothamnus Becklarii". Ich habe die Pflanze gesammelt, sie hat meinen Namen — und ich kenne sie gar nicht — das ist famos!]

[I came back from the mountains a few days ago and hoped to find a letter from Dr Mueller and my recall to Melbourne, as having had so little success spoils everything for me. I am now supposed to go to the Mc[...]
Probably Macleay River. typescript has a gap there, the person doing it probably could not decipher the MS. Can the MS be checked on the Microfilm in La Trobe Library? Perhaps get a print-out of the relevant part? (near the end of the letter). See also footnote 5 below.
and hope to do better there.
In the next letter to his brother Carl from Grafton, 16 March 1860, he writes: 'Not satisfied with my collections from the Hastings and upper scrub ... I returned to Macquarie, half discouraged, ... and thought of packing up my plants to wait for Dr Mueller to call me back to Melbourne. On arrival I found a letter and could travel for another three months. So I soon moved on again, beginning my journey with a boat trip to the Macleay [River].' I hear nothing at all about the expedition. Dr Mueller sent me the 8th fascicle of the Fragmenta,
B59.11.01. in which he named an Ozothamnus, which I found here, after me Ozothamnus becklarii. I have collected the plant, it has my name — and I don't even know it, — that is great!]
